alert.note: Alert for Central Mountains; Sanpete Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 4:51PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Sanpete...east central Juab and south central Utah Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 450 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 17 miles north of Mount Pleasant, or 18 miles north of Moroni, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Birdseye and Indianola. This includes the following highways... US Route 6 between mile markers 186 and 192. US Route 89 between mile markers 292 and 312. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Mountains; Sanpete Valley; Wasatch Mountains South of I-80; Wasatch Plateau, Book Cliffs
